alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 6:51PM EDT until April 22 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Camden County in southern New Jersey... Central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 651 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Cherry Hill to Sicklerville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Magnolia, Beverly, Tullytown and Chesilhurst. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 6A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 30 and 56. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 32 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
